slides.title: History of Hamburgers
content: Originated in the 19th century in the United States
Popularized by fast food chains in the 20th century
Evolved to include various toppings and flavors
image_prompts: Hamburger on a vintage advertisement
Evolution of hamburger toppings
People enjoying hamburgers at a picnic
slides.speaker_notes: In this slide, we will discuss the history of hamburgers, from their origins to their evolution in the fast food industry. It would be great to include images of a vintage hamburger advertisement, the different toppings that have been added to hamburgers over time, and people enjoying hamburgers at a picnic or gathering.

slides.title: Types of Hamburgers
content: Classic hamburger: beef patty with lettuce, tomato, and onion
Cheeseburger: classic hamburger with cheese
Veggie burger: plant-based patty for vegetarian or vegan options
image_prompts: Delicious classic hamburger with lettuce, tomato, and onion
Cheeseburger with melted cheese oozing out
Tasty veggie burger with avocado and sprouts
slides.speaker_notes: In this slide, we will explore the different types of hamburgers available. We can include images of a delicious classic hamburger with all the toppings, a cheeseburger with melting cheese, and a tasty veggie burger with avocado and sprouts to show the variety of options.

slides.title: Hamburger Trivia
content: The largest hamburger ever made weighed over 3,000 pounds
Americans consume over 50 billion hamburgers each year
The world's most expensive hamburger costs $5,000
image_prompts: Giant hamburger weighing over 3,000 pounds
Stack of hamburgers representing billions consumed
Luxurious hamburger with gold leaf and caviar
slides.speaker_notes: In this slide, we will share some interesting hamburger trivia. It would be great to include images of a giant hamburger weighing over 3,000 pounds, a stack of hamburgers to represent the billions consumed each year, and a luxurious hamburger with gold leaf and caviar to illustrate the most expensive burger.

slides.title: Hamburgers Around the World
content: In Japan: Teriyaki burger with soy-based sauce
In Germany: Frikadelle, a pan-fried meat patty
In India: Aloo Tikki burger with a potato patty
image_prompts: Delicious teriyaki burger with soy-based sauce
Traditional German Frikadelle burger
Spicy Aloo Tikki burger with a potato patty
slides.speaker_notes: In this slide, we will explore the different variations of hamburgers around the world. We can include images of a delicious teriyaki burger with soy-based sauce from Japan, a traditional German Frikadelle burger, and a spicy Aloo Tikki burger with a potato patty from India to showcase the global diversity of hamburgers.

slides.title: Healthier Hamburger Options
content: Turkey burger: leaner meat option
Portobello mushroom burger: vegetarian alternative
Lettuce wrap burger: low-carb option
image_prompts: Juicy turkey burger with fresh toppings
Grilled Portobello mushroom burger with melted cheese
Lettuce wrap burger with a flavorful patty
slides.speaker_notes: In this slide, we will discuss healthier options for hamburgers. It would be great to include images of a juicy turkey burger with fresh toppings, a grilled Portobello mushroom burger with melted cheese, and a lettuce wrap burger with a flavorful patty to showcase alternative choices for those looking for healthier options.

Understanding the different types of tissues helps in diagnosing and treating various diseases and conditions.

image_prompts: A finish line with a winner crossing it - symbolizing the completion of the presentation

speaker_notes: In the conclusion slide, you want to reinforce the main points or topics discussed in the presentation. Restate the key message or takeaway that you want the audience to remember. End with a strong and memorable closing statement that leaves a lasting impression.

speaker_notes.title: Q&A
content: Ram-don burger: inspired by the movie 'Parasite'
Rainbow burger: vibrant and colorful
Doughnut burger: sweet and savory combination
image_prompts: Innovative ram-don burger inspired by 'Parasite'
